mechanoreception.notes: Nematodes generally possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch, pressure, and movement in their environment. This is inferred to be present in Epsilonematidae.

chemoreception.notes: Nematodes use chemoreception to locate food sources and detect chemical signals in their environment. This is inferred to be present in Epsilonematidae.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of vision in Epsilonematidae is currently unknown.
